awd_abstract_narration: Alma College requests support from NSF for an upgrade of their                  slow speed connection to a medium speed connection of its campus                network to NSFNET.  MERIT is the midlevel network located in the                state of Michigan that will provide operations and network                      information services.  It will give Alma College a 56 thousand                  bits per second connection to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45                million bits per second) National Backbone network.                                                                                                             The College needs greater functionality and network speed to be                 able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file transfers               along with being able to implement a more reliable mail system.                 Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.  This                 is also a unique opportunity for the school to explore innovative               educational resources.***//
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
